intro: Ficus polycarpa var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved fig, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible fig fruits. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Its foliage makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor ornamental gardening.
